page.title: 06Religion_Chideock area
page.content: At Morcombelake on the south side of the A.35 road there stands the Anglican Parish church of Stanton St. Gabriel which was built in 1841.The church building consists of a nave with a Bellcote ond Chancel in one with the entrance on the Western side. Around the building there is a burial ground. The Roman Catholic adherents are served by the Church of our Lady of Matyrs and St. Ignatius which adjoins the present Manor House. For many centuries the owners of ther Manor have practised the Roman Catholic religion. The building of the church was commenced in1815 and acheived it's present form in 1872, through the efforts of the Weld family who still own and occupy the adjoining Manor House. The continuous observation of ther R.C. services in Chideock ,
